drug.name: Phosphoenolpyruvate
drug.synthesis-reference: Naotaka Hamasaki, Hirotaka Kawamura, Norio Ohtsu, Ichiro Nakakoshi, Kikuo Ataka, Kiyosi Oomori, Masahiko Kouno, "Process for preparing monosodium phosphoenolpyruvate." U.S. Patent US4874882, issued October, 1984.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phosphate esters. These are organic compounds containing phosphoric acid ester functional group, with the general structure R1P(=O)(R2)OR3. R1,R2 = O,N, or halogen atom; R3 = organyl group.

pathway.name: Glycogen Storage Disease Type 1A (GSD1A) or Von Gierke Disease
Salla Disease/Infantile Sialic Acid Storage Disease
Pyruvate Decarboxylase E1 Component Deficiency (PDHE1 Deficiency)
Glycogenosis, Type IA. Von Gierke Disease

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Phospho-2-dehydro-3-deoxyheptonate aldolase, Phe-sensitive
polypeptide.specific-function: Stereospecific condensation of phosphoenolpyruvate (PEP) and D-erythrose-4-phosphate (E4P) giving rise to 3-deoxy-D-arabino-heptulosonate-7-phosphate (DAHP).

go-classifier.description: aromatic amino acid family biosynthetic process

Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Beta-enolase
polypeptide.specific-function: Appears to have a function in striated muscle development and regeneration.

synonyms.synonym: Spore coat polysaccharide biosynthesis protein spsE

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase, cytosolic [GTP]
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the conversion of oxaloacetate (OAA) to phosphoenolpyruvate (PEP), the rate-limiting step in the metabolic pathway that produces glucose from lactate and other precursors derived from the citric acid cycle.

go-classifier.description: cellular response to potassium ion starvation
positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter in response to acidic pH

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

target.name: Phospho-2-dehydro-3-deoxyheptonate aldolase
target.organism: Thermotoga maritima (strain ATCC 43589 / MSB8 / DSM 3109 / JCM 10099)

polypeptide.name: Phospho-2-dehydro-3-deoxyheptonate aldolase
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the condensation of phosphoenolpyruvate (PEP) and D-erythrose-4-phosphate (E4P) giving rise to 3-deoxy-D-arabino-heptulosonate-7-phosphate (DAHP).
polypeptide.organism: Thermotoga maritima (strain ATCC 43589 / MSB8 / DSM 3109 / JCM 10099)

go-classifier.description: aromatic amino acid family biosynthetic process

transporter.name: Solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 2A1

article.citation: Chan BS, Endo S, Kanai N, Schuster VL: Identification of lactate as a driving force for prostanoid transport by prostaglandin transporter PGT. Am J Physiol Renal Physiol. 2002 Jun;282(6):F1097-102.

polypeptide.name: Solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 2A1
polypeptide.general-function: Sodium-independent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity
polypeptide.specific-function: May mediate the release of newly synthesized prostaglandins from cells, the transepithelial transport of prostaglandins, and the clearance of prostaglandins from the circulation. Transports PGD2, as well as PGE1, PGE2 and PGF2A.
